title: A few changes I'd like to see

replies.body:
morde changes no, hes already bulky enough, he needs raw ability utility, not compensation for bad trades and poor management. 

brand no, rylais still surpasses anything you put on conflag, hes primarily fine except for his synergy with rylais, he just shouldn't proc it off his passive.

vlad no, already too difficult to kill, he gets too much burst healing off his Q which is the core issue here. burst healing as shown on darius, is the problem.  vlad is one of the champs who **should** have 325ms specifically for his late game scaling. 

glip changes ok, it really should be looked at for being picked up for helping secure key skill shots and additional damage.

rab cap the only great thing you said, but that puts the item over the top as a must build item. rab cap is seen as the premier damage choice for mages but its worthless as a first or second item buy. third is even questionable which it shouldn't be. it ultimately needs a higher base, not scaling. which would say hey, you want ap damage, this is the item to build. to offer a real ap power spike. morellos is the only item which does that at the moment. 

rylias doesn't need extra health, its already quite a bit as is. it needs more attention than stat remodeling. 

malzahar good positive change.

Mordekaiser shields himself for 25% of the damage dealt by his abilities, halved to 12.5% against enemy minion and capped at 25% maximum health.
After a 1.5 seconds delay, Iron Man's shield decays at a rate of 1.5% base health per second down to a minimum of 「 6.25% maximum health 」.

this is what you play around, if you cant do it you cant play morde right or ever hope to succeed. if you give him additional base values you scale all of this up too. morde needs ability revamps, thats all there is too it, nothing in it is good or something worth capitalizing on.

not to mention his healing on W + R

His abilities cost hp, he has no mobility, no cc, and is short ranged. Until he builds tanky items, he is quite squishy. It is easier for his enemies to play around his passive than it is for him to play around it. All they need to do is kite/back off until its time to go in. Early game Morde's windows of power are limited and he doesn't have the tank to fall back on during his down time.

Brand's conflagrate can't be dodged. It's a point and click ability that hits everything that isnt affected by blaze if the initial target is hit by blaze.
I'd definitely like to see Azir not married to Rylai's.
Or Nashors Tooth for that matter.

He's a late-game DPS mage that scales well with attack speed. It's not really strange that he likes the item. It definitely doesn't augment him in as gross a fashion as Rylai's does (though Nashor's, Rylai's, and Thunderlord's are the three things he currently combines to make the problems inherent in his kit just that much worse).
Malz already has that, btw.

Once again, I'd rather have Rylais (and Frozen Mallet) be straight up removed rather than let people continue to itemize into permaslows.

Morde in particular would require additional work if that were to happen, but I'd rather have a Morde with a slow on one of his basic abilites from level 1 than have any mage get slows on _every_ basic ability.
A lot of champions rely on these items because they have little cc themselves or need to stick to targets better, like A Sol.

Not everyone is meant to stick to targets. A lack of chase potential is an intended weakness for many champions and not something that should be able to be completely itemized out of. There are options that will minimize that problem that are infinitely more healthy than Rylais, such as GLP, Gunblade, Frost Queen's, and Iceborn.

If a champion is truly, 100% dependent on Rylais to function, a la Morde, they would obviously see more significant buffs than other mages should Rylais be removed. Right now the only champions that even come close to that are Viktor and A Sol.
And then there are champs like Yasuo, Gnar, Teemo, Cassiopeia, etc
Sounds reasonable.
